metadata.title: CVE-2017-13134 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.6-6 and GraphicsMagick 1.3.26, a heap-based bufferover-read was found in the function SFWScan in coders/sfw.c, which allowsattackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13134` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
graphicsmagick: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
